articles.title: Greetings to President of Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Sri Lanka
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Maithripala Sirisena, president of Sri Lanka, on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished the president success in his work for the country's political stability and economic development and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop.

articles.title: Enlarged Plenary Meeting of C.C., Democratic Women's Union of Korea Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Plenary Meeting of C.C., Democratic Women's Union of Korea Held
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The enlarge meeting of the 68th plenary meeting of the C.C., the Democratic Women's Union of Korea was held here on Tuesday. 
					 Present there were members and alternate members of the C.C., women's union and its officials in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The meeting discussed the tasks of the women's union organizations to devotedly carry out the tasks set forth by Marshal Kim Jong Un in his New Year address. 
					
					 Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the union, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 They called on the women's union organizations at various levels to dynamically conduct organizational and political work and a mass movement to uphold the Songun revolutionary leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea with loyalty.
					
					 They called on officials of the women's union to do its work in a revolutionary and unique manner and make redoubled efforts in the van of the masses. 
					
					 They underscored the need to devotedly carry out the tasks set forth in the New Year address, rallied close around Kim Jong Un, bring about a fundamental turn in the work of the union and thus glorify this significant year as a year of great victory and great revolutionary and auspicious event.

articles.title: Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals of DPRK
articles.content:
Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Academic degrees and titles were awarded to intellectuals of the DPRK on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The title of academician was awarded to Pak Tong Ho, researcher at the Veterinary Institute of the Academy of Agricultural Science, and the title of candidate academician to Jon Chol Rye, researcher at Hamhung University of Hydraulic Engineering.
					
					 Professorship went to Kim Song Ho, department head of Kim Il Sung University, Ri Kwang Su, department head of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Kim Song Yu, section chief of the Korea General Red Cross Hospital, and ten others.
					
					 Doctorate was conferred upon Kim Kum Suk, department head of the University of National Economy, Kil Jong Su, department head of Nampho University of Fisheries, Pak Song Ryong, manager of the Samcholli Lighting Appliances Factory, and others and assistant professorship went to 138 intellectuals.
					
					 A ceremony of awarding the academic degrees and titles took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.

articles.title: School Youth and Children from Across Country Make Study Tour
articles.content:
School Youth and Children from Across Country Make Study Tour 
						
 Phophyong, February 3 (KCNA) -- The study tour by school youth and children from across the country along the course of the 250-mile journey for national liberation was successfully wound up. It was organized on the occasions of the 90th anniversary of the 250-mile journey for national liberation made by President Kim Il Sung and the 40th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's organizing of the march along the course.
					 The members of the study tour group left Mangyongdae, Pyongyang on Jan. 22 and hastened their march along the course of the 250-mile journey for national liberation and arrived in Phophyong in Kim Hyong Jik County, Ryanggang Province on Feb. 3.
					
					  Phophyong is the historic place from where the President crossed the River Amnok in his teens with a firm pledge not to return home unless Korea became independent. 
					
					 Upon arriving there, they held a meeting before the statue of Kim Il Sung in Phophyong.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials of the youth league and members of the tour group.
					
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets before his statue and paid tribute to him.
					
					 A congratulatory message of the C.C., the WPK to the participants of the study tour was read out at the meeting.
					
					 The message highly praised the participants of the study tour for having powerfully demonstrated the firm faith and will of the successors to dynamically make long journeys of the revolution under the leadership of the party. 
					
					 It expressed belief that the participants of the study tour and all other school youth and children of the country would fully exalt the honor of being true young vanguard and juvenile guards on the road of advancing straight along the road indicated by the Party Central Committee, flying the flags bearing the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before the flag of the youth league and the flag of the children's union.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Historic 250-mile Journey for National Liberation Continues
articles.content:
Historic 250-mile Journey for National Liberation Continues
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The historic 250-mile journey, made by President Kim Il Sung for national liberation 90 years ago, is still continued by schoolchildren in the DPRK.
					 Kim Il Sung crossed the River Amnok at the age of 13 on February 3, Juche 14 (1925), with a grim resolve not to return home before Korea had become independent. Keeping the resolve deep in his mind, he liberated the country from Japan's colonial rule through protracted anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 The schoolchildren's expedition of the journey course in the country started in 1975 on the initiative of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Since then, they have made expedition of the 250-mile journey every year, through which they grasp the revolutionary faith of the President and the principle that the independence and freedom of the country can be achieved only by dint of arms.
					
					 During the expedition, the schoolchildren harden their will to prepare themselves to be reliable successors to the revolution, true to the Songun (military-first) leadership of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: New Posters Produced
articles.content:
New Posters Produced
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- New posters were produced to inspire the army and people in the drive for carrying out the tasks set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year address.
					 The posters were produced by the Mansudae Art Studio, the Korean Central Fine Arts Studio, the Art Studio of the Ministry of Railways and Pyongyang University of Fine Arts.
					
					 The posters reflecting the spirit of the era and strong in appeal include poster "Let's us turn out in the general offensive to hasten a final victory in the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu!" They call on the service personnel and people to become honorable victors in the general offensive for exalting the dignity of the country and achieving prosperity by dint of ideology, arms and science and technology with soul and spirit of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 There are posters calling for making a fresh landmark in boosting the leadership ability and militancy of the Party this year marking its 70th founding anniversary.
					
					 Posters also call for bringing about a fresh turn in building revolutionary armed forces, making full preparations for all-people resistance, stepping up the building of a highly civilized socialist nation and opening up a wide avenue to independent reunification by the concerted efforts of all Koreans.

articles.title: Feats of KPA Guards Units (1)
articles.content:
Feats of KPA Guards Units (1)
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The history of the Korean People's Army (KPA), which developed into regular armed forces on Feb. 8, Juche 37 (1948), is associated with the heroic feats its guards units performed to win in the 1950-1953 Fatherland Liberation War ignited by the U.S. imperialist aggressors.
					 Among those units is the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division, which achieved brilliant results in the battle to liberate Seoul City during the war.
					
					 When the KPA launched its immediate counterattack against the U.S. imperialists' armed invasion, the tanks of the Division blasted their way into Seoul as an advance party on the order to liberate the city, the stronghold of the enemy, at once.
					
					 Its tank-men bravely entered the city through a shower of enemy shells and bullets to raise the DPRK flag over its sky. Then they attacked the Sodaemun Prison in the city to release thousands of patriots and the broadcasting station to announce the liberation of Seoul.
					
					 After all, the city of Seoul was liberated only in three days after the outbreak of war.
					
					 In the same spirit, those tank-men of the Division, together with infantrymen, broke the enemy's much vaunted "impregnable defences" along the River Kum at a breath to ensure the successful siege of Taejon.
					
					 In July 1950 the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly awarded the title of Guards to the Division in recognition of its distinguished feats in the counter-offensive operation of the KPA.
					
					 During the war, the Division wiped out myriads of enemy's manpower and destroyed several hundred pieces of combat equipment including guns, tanks and armored vehicles while producing scores of DPRK heroes.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il started his Songun (military-first) leadership with inspection of this Division on Aug. 25, 1960.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the KPA, visited the unit on Jan. 1, 2012, declaring his steadfast will to accomplish the cause of Songun revolution pioneered and led by the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division is a pride of the heroic KPA as it has taken the lead in safeguarding the party and leader in the grim annals of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Double Standards Cannot Be Allowed in Human Rights Issue: Minju Joson
articles.content:
No Double Standards Cannot Be Allowed in Human Rights Issue: Minju Joson
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- International human rights organizations and many countries of the world are expressing support and sympathy with the proposal of the DPRK on putting torture by CIA as an agenda item of the UN Human Rights Council due in March and forming an independent commission of inquiry, says Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary.
					 This proves that though the U.S. is perpetrating high-handed and arbitrary practices in international arena, boasting of being a big country, it can never stamp out international justice and conscience of mankind, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is styling itself a big power but is no more than a member of the international community.
					
					 If the U.S. has a question in the human rights sector, it should also be judged at the international human rights tribunal now that it has been fingered as the worst human rights abuser in the world.
					
					 World public is strongly demanding an immediate abolition of the Guantanamo concentration camp which puts the Oswiecim concentration camp of Hitler in the shade.
					
					 The torture and maltreatment of prisoners by CIA are a wanton violation and an extreme challenge to human rights and democracy.
					
					 Such a top-class criminal state has not yet been called into question by international law, another grave crime disturbing the impartiality of international order and fostering human rights abuses.
					
					 No double standards can be allowed in the human rights issue.
					
					 That is why the international community is taking a serious note of the torture by CIA and insisting on a stern punishment of those responsible.
					
					 The UN with a mission to protect, improve and promote human rights worldwide should take measures of calling into question the U.S., the kingpin of human rights abuses, and punish it, to begin with.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Authorities Accused of Pulling up DPRK over Its Nukes for Self-Defence
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Authorities Accused of Pulling up DPRK over Its Nukes for Self-Defence
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is crying out for "the north's dismantlement of nukes" in a bid to create impression that the situation on the Korean Peninsula and in other parts of Northeast Asia remains unstable due to the DPRK's nuclear deterrence whenever an opportunity presents itself.
					 The south Korean authorities never miss a chance to talk rubbish that the building of "a world without nuclear weapons" should begin with the "north's dismantlement of its nukes" and "the north is urged to make a bold strategic decision to abandon its nukes."
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in an article in this regard: 
					
					 It is brazen-faced, indeed, for the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to malignantly pull up the DPRK over its nuclear deterrent for self-defence. 
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities' claim that peace can be ensured and tension be defused only when the DPRK dismantles its nukes is no more than profound confusing of right and wrong.
					
					 Citing facts to prove that the nuclear issue of the Korean peninsula was spawned by the evermore desperate racket of the U.S. and its lackeys the south Korean authorities to provoke a nuclear war, the article goes on:
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities can neither conceal their true colors as the very ones that spawned the nuclear issue and seriously harassed peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in other parts of Northeast Asia by posing a nuclear threat to the DPRK nor evade their responsibility for doing so.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to bolster up in every way its nuclear deterrence for self-defence to cope with the evermore desperate moves of the hostile forces for aggression.
					
					 In order to find a fundamental solution to the nuclear issue on the peninsula, it is necessary to put an end to the U.S. and the south Korean war maniacs' nuclear blackmail and threat and defuse the danger of a war against the DPRK, first of all. The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should face up to the reality with a cool head.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Revise SL
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Revise SL
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The minister of Justice of south Korea, delivering a report some days ago "2015 working plan," blustered that he would regard the "preservation of the nature of the system through the protection of the value of the constitution" as the top priority task and revise the 'Security Law" (SL) in such a manner as to disband "anti-state organizations" and "enemy-profiting ones" and block their activities. In response to his outbursts, the south Korean chief executive encouraged the retrogressive revision of the SL, vociferating about "strict enforcement of law." 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 A lot of people have grievously shed their blood and were killed by the above-said law. 
					
					 The SL should have been thrown into the dumping ground of history as it violates democracy and human rights and supports dictatorial rule. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities are mulling revising the law in a more fascist manner, far from repealing it. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that their moves were prompted by a despicable trick to tide over the ruling crisis and realize their ambition for long-term office. 
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the improvement of the inter-Korean relations much touted by the south Korean authorities is nothing but empty rhetoric and what they seek is to tighten the fascist dictatorial rule and prolong the country-selling regime. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should clearly know that suppression is not cure-all and staking their fate on the anachronistic SL would only precipitate the end of the dictatorial rule. 
					
					 Those who persistently resort to moves against reunification and fascist dictatorship contrary to the public mindset will not be able to escape severe punishment by the times and the nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Ideology and Faith
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Ideology and Faith 
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Korean-style socialism is firmly preserving its revolutionary nature despite all kinds of storms and stress of history and making a long drive amid the absolute support of all service personnel and people, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. and other imperialist reactionaries are pulling up the dignified DPRK this or that way. This is nothing but the last-ditch efforts of those taken aback by the DPRK's invincibility and might.
					
					 There is no need for the DPRK to sit at a negotiating table with rabid dogs who openly bark that they will bring down the socialist system, the cradle which the Korean people consider dearer than their own lives, by leading it to "changes". The DPRK should settle accounts with them only through resolute military counteraction.
					
					 It can be said that a battle with the enemy is not only confrontation of arms and equipment and physical strength but also confrontation of mental power and ideology of people. 
					
					 The Korean revolution was started and emerges victorious by dint of arms of ideology and faith.
					
					 Only the army which has grown strong thanks to ideology and faith is powerful enough to push forward the revolution. This is the historic review of our revolutionary practice which has weathered all difficulties.
					
					 The DPRK has won one victory after another in the fierce political and military confrontation with imperialism and achieved shining successes in all fabrics of social life including economy and culture. This is the shining fruits yielded by ideology and faith.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Congratulates Founding Anniversary of Communist Party of Vietnam
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Congratulates Founding Anniversary of Communist Party of Vietnam
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dedicates an article to the 85th anniversary of the Communist Party of Vietnam.
					 The foundation of the party, a vanguard unit of the revolution, under the leadership of President Ho Chi Minh enabled the Vietnamese people to advance with confidence along the road of building independent and prosperous society, while braving the repeated invasions by the imperialists, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea and people of the DPRK are rejoiced over the fact that the Vietnamese people are exerting strenuous efforts to build powerful and prosperous society as desired by Ho Chi Minh despite the undisguised moves of the imperialists and the reactionaries.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and the two peoples have long-standing history and tradition. Their roots are comradeship between President Kim Il Sung and President Ho Chi Minh. Based on this, the two peoples pooled intention and fought hand in hand in the stern and arduous road of struggle against the imperialist aggressor forces, common enemy of the two peoples.
					
					 Today the friendly relations between the DPRK and Vietnam have entered a new phase of development.
					
					 To develop these relations is in line with the interests of the two peoples. This is beneficial to advancing socialist construction in the two countries and ensuring peace and security in Asia and the world.
					
					 The people of the DPRK are convinced that the excellent traditions of solidarity and cooperation between the two parties and the two countries will invariably be carried forward thanks to the joint efforts.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Raps S. Korean FM's Ridiculous Behavior
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Raps S. Korean FM's Ridiculous Behavior 
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, minister of Foreign Affairs of south Korea, showed his very ridiculous behavior from the first month of the new year.
					 He made his first trip in the new year to the Osan air force base where he trumpeted about the south Korea-U.S. joint defence posture and "blood alliance".
					
					 At the briefing on the ministry's duty for this year before domestic and foreign media, he blustered that he would focus the south Korean diplomacy on pressing the north to make denuclearization process.
					
					 At the 45th annual meeting of the World Economic Forum held in Switzerland, he termed the DPRK's nuclear deterrence for self-defence a cancer-like factor of bedeviling south-north relations and disturbing peace in Northeast Asia and told rubbish that one couldn't talk about peaceful unification unless the issue of denuclearization of the north is settled. 
					
					 He seems to be unable to discern his job; whether he is foreign minister or defense minister. This hectic diplomacy started by this political imbecile from the outset of the year suggests another disgrace for south Korea ill-famed for flunkeyism and submission.
					
					 What he is doing is nothing but acts of treachery.
					
					 He is a wicked confrontation element who has pursued confrontation with compatriots since he became diplomatic boss.
					
					 He malignantly slandered the DPRK's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts, crying out for "the north's dismantlement of nukes" and "changes" whenever an opportunity presented itself. He has worked with bloodshot eyes to intensify the smear campaign against the DPRK, taking the lead in the international racket against it over its nuclear issue.
					
					 He is such a maniac that in "a speech" made on the Day of the United Nations he let loose a spate of invectives that the north's advocacy of a nuclear weapons state is "a challenge to the UN".
					
					 Last year, too, he was busy arranging a public discussion in the U.S. and making a speech on invitation. He called on the international community to strongly counter the north's access to nukes, claiming that it would further increase tension and instability in Northeast Asia.
					
					 What he uttered is nothing but ridiculous jargons of the colonial servant of the U.S. who has lost ability to properly judge things owing to his bitterness towards the compatriots in the north and total dependence on outsiders. 
					
					 Tragedy is that Yun has no elementary common knowledge about the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 As well known to the world, the nuclear issue on the peninsula was spawned as the U.S. turned south Korea into the biggest nuclear arsenal and constantly threatened and blackmailed the DPRK with ceaseless nuclear war drills for invading it.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrent serves as a mighty treasured sword for protecting the dignity and sovereignty of the country and nation and guaranteeing the happiness of the people and prosperity of a reunified country.
					
					 But for the nuclear deterrent for self-defence, the Korean nation would have suffered a nuclear disaster, to say nothing of the peace and stability on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is the height of folly for Yun to take issue with the DPRK's just line and nuclear deterrent for the country and nation, far from saying any word in protest against the foreign forces who spawned the nuclear issue on the peninsula. 
					
					 Yun has perpetrated more wicked acts of treachery at home and abroad since the DPRK advanced the proposal for achieving great national unity of all Koreans and opening up a broad avenue to independent reunification in this year, the 70th anniversary of Korea's division. His behavior can never be overlooked.
					
					 Such despicable stooges of the outsiders as Yun having not an iota of national self-esteem are bound to go to ruin.

articles.title: U.S. Nuclear Submarine Enters S. Korean Port
articles.content:
U.S. Nuclear Submarine Enters S. Korean Port
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Nuclear submarine of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces Olympia entered the naval base in Jinhae of south Korea on Jan. 30 to take part in the war exercises against the north, according to south Korean KBS. 
					 This submarine entered the base under the pretext of cooking up a submarine command of the south Korean military authorities. It is planning to conduct joint military exercises with submarines of the south Korean navy for three days from February 5. 
					
					 From the outset of the year the U.S. sent an Aegis destroyer to the East and West seas of Korea for madcap war exercises against the north. The U.S. is openly revealing its attempt at preemptive attack on the DPRK with nuclear submarines involved. 
					
					 This is a dangerous war scenario as it is aimed to egg the south Korean authorities on to chill the atmosphere for mending the north-south relations with gruesome saber-rattling.

articles.title: S. Korean Lawmaker Accused of Shielding Sexual Abuses
articles.content:
S. Korean Lawmaker Accused of Shielding Sexual Abuses
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- South Korean Kyunghyang Daily News carried an editorial denouncing a lawmaker from the "Saenuri Party" for his shameless remarks shielding sexual abuses rampant within the south Korean army.
					 As regards the recent case of an army brigade commander who sexually assaulted a service woman under his command, Song Yong Gun, a lawmaker from the "Saenuri Party", patronized the former, terming the case a problem caused by the lack of chances to stop out, the editorial noted, adding:
					
					 This is very stunning sophism that can never be pardoned.
					
					 Not content with covering up and defending the sexual abuses in the army, the lawmaker revealed his mean idea through his reckless remarks. They are not utterances of an individual but reflected the common view of the military.
					
					 Sexual abusers should be strictly punished.
					
					 The editorial urged Song to make an apology before the people for his reckless remarks, in stead of making lame excuses.

articles.title: S. Korean Supreme Court Accused of Covering Up Truth behind Fraud
articles.content:
S. Korean Supreme Court Accused of Covering Up Truth behind Fraud 
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Supreme Court of south Korea on Jan. 29 declared Kim Yong Phan, former chief of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency, not guilty though he took the lead in covering up the truth behind the interference in the election. 
					 During the "presidential election" in 2012 the regime mobilized the Intelligence Service (IS) and other power bodies and even the military for red herring in a bid to get the candidate from the "Saenuri Party" elected. 
					
					 At that time a woman agent of the IS was found out while posting on website an article slandering a candidate from an opposition party at a hotel in Seoul. The truth about the interference began to be disclosed with this case as a momentum.
					
					 The mounting public criticism compelled the regime to start an investigation for mere form's sake, but Kim Yong Phan obstructed it in every way. 
					
					 He pressed not only the shelving of the application of warrant for search against the woman agent but playing down of investigation. 
					
					 When evidence proving her wrongdoings was found, he instructed the destruction of it and announcement of false results of intermediary investigation. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the Supreme Court passed a decision of not guilty upon Kim Yong Phan, claiming "his crime could not be verified".

articles.title: S. Koreans Call for Anti-"government" Actions
articles.content:
S. Koreans Call for Anti-"government" Actions 
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- At least 1 000 members of civic and social organizations in Seoul held a meeting in Seoul on Jan. 31 calling for actions against the "government", according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Minbo.
					 At the meeting speakers termed the present situation crisis of democracy.
					
					 They deplored that people are hard to live as the present regime imposes heavier burden of taxes upon them while lessening the one of the rich.
					
					 The regime is suppressing those calling for peace and reunification by labeling them "followers of the north" and pushing the south-north relations to escalated confrontation, they said, adding:
					
					 We cannot overlook the present situation where the Unified Progressive Party was forcibly dissolved and the case of attempted rebellion cooked up.
					
					 Recalling the present executive chief was elected through rigging with most of "government" organs including the Intelligence Service involved, they called on the people from all walks of life to take to streets on the occasion of two years of her office to demand the regime step down.
					
					 They called for making the anti-"government" actions spill over to all parts of south Korea.
					
					 At the end of the meeting the participants staged a candlelight demonstration toward the Chonggye plaza.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Suppress Sit-in Strikers
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Suppress Sit-in Strikers
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities put down the sit-in strike of residents and social activities protesting against the building of the Jeju naval base on January 31.
					 At least 1 000 riot force including navy, police and gangsters were hurled into the crackdown operation.
					
					 Many people were wounded and dozens of others walked off by police and tents were forcibly removed.
					
					 South Korean media reported that the terrible scene in Kangjong village on Jeju Island that day was reminiscent of a battle field.
					
					 This not withstanding, the military authorities are trying to justify their crime, claiming that they "respected the opinions of inhabitants" and "it was an unavoidable measure."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" was published in pamphlet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on January 27.
					 The work, made public on January 3, Juche 81 (1992), indicates that the historical lesson in building socialism requires steadily developing the driving force of the revolution with the faith in socialism and the right guiding idea, holding fast to the principle of socialism and strengthening comradely unity and cooperation on the basis of independence.
					
					 It clarifies the idea that it is the general line of the Workers' Party of Korea for building socialism to thoroughly carry out the three revolutions--ideological, technological and cultural--while steadily augmenting the people's government and enhancing its function and role. It also indicates the validity of the idea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Malaysia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Malaysia
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A Malaysian preparatory committee for marking leader Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on January 28.
					 Chong Chingchi, manager of the Dombo Enterprise Company of Malaysia, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to widely introduce the sacred revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il and the reality of the DPRK dynamically advancing under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and arrange colorful political and cultural events including meeting and seminar in the period from January 28 to February 16.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Hungary
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Hungary
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A Hungarian preparatory committee for marking leader Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Budapest on January 29.
					 Gyula Thurmer, chairman of the Hungarian Workers' Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee set the celebration period from January 29 to February 18 and decided to organize events to praise the sacred revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il in the capital and local areas in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea for celebrating the 73rd birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Moscow on January 28.
					 According to information on the inauguration of the preparatory committee, it consists of Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, and other 16 personages of Juche idea study organizations.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize working groups for events marking the Day of the Shining Star at the Juche idea study organizations till February 1, hold a seminar on the sacred revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il and meeting and carry and post data on his greatness in publications and on websites.
					
					 And it decided to send a congratulatory message to supreme leader Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Malaysian Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Malaysian Figure
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The feats performed by leader Kim Jong Il will go down in history, said Chong Chingchi, manager of the Dombo Enterprise Company who is chairman of the Malaysian preparatory committee for marking Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary, at its inaugural ceremony on Jan. 28.
					 On the occasion of the birth anniversary he paid the highest tribute to Kim Jong Il who devoted himself to the happiness of the Korean people and the protection of the sovereignty of the country 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il pursued original Songun politics, winning victories in the showdown with the U.S. imperialists and turning the DPRK into a military power and socialist bulwark with nuclear deterrent.
					
					 Under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un the Korean people are dynamically struggling for the victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 I am convinced that the Korean people will keep to the road of independence, Songun and socialism under the banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in the future, too, and thus win the final victory.

articles.title: Russian Organization Denounces U.S. "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Organization Denounces U.S. "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK made public a statement on Jan. 28 in denunciation of the U.S. "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 We are stunned by the "report of the Commission of Inquiry" on the human rights record in the DPRK.
					
					 The report was faked up by the U.S. and its vassal forces, ignorant and incompetent being servile to the U.S. instructions.
					
					 None of the members of the Commission of Inquiry has been to the DPR of Korea nor talked with its ordinary people.
					
					 They turn their faces away from the remarkable successes being made by the Korean people despite the vicious sanctions of the West. 
					
					 All the "information" gathered by them was based on the "testimonies" by the "defectors from the north".
					
					 However, a "defector" recently confessed all his "testimonies" were lies and that he said lies merely to get more dollars from his new master U.S., thus throwing the U.S. and its stooges in a dilemma in the world eyes.
					
					 The U.S. has trumpeted about "human rights" more loudly than anyone else.
					
					 It destroyed Libya and Iraq for "human rights". Not long ago, young black men were killed in the U.S. This is American-style "human rights".
					
					 We are convinced that the day will surely come when these "human rights champions" will be brought to trial for their innumerous crimes.
					
					 We demand no interference in the internal affairs of the DPRK, an independent and sovereign state.
					
					 The reason is that truth stands for the Korean people, not for the "defectors from the north" and their patrons.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Sri Lanka
Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, remitio ayer un mensaje de felicitacion a Maithripala Sirisena, presidente de la Republica Democratica Socialista de Sri Lanka, en ocasion del 67o aniversario de la independencia de este pais asiatico.
					En su misiva, el remitente deseo exitos en las labores del destinatario por la estabilidad politica y el desarrollo economico del pais y manifesto la conviccion de que seguiran desarrollandose positivamente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Sergio Mattarella
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Sergio Mattarella
Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de felicitacion a Sergio Mattarella electo como presidente de la Republica de Italia,.
					En el mensaje, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que las relaciones entre ambos paises amistosos se ampliaran y se desarrollaran conforme a los intereses mutuos e hizo votos por los exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario por la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de condolencias al presidente de Egipto
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de condolencias al presidente de Egipto
						
Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Republica Arabe de Egipto, Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, en relacion con que hubo muchas perdidas humanas en el ataque terrorista ocurrido en el norte de Sinai.
					En la misiva, el remitente expreso profundas condolencias al destinatario y al pueblo de Egipto y a los familiares de las victimas.
					
					Condenando categoricamente el atentado terrorista como acto sucio que rompe la estabilidad sociopolitica y la unidad nacional de Egipto, deseo que el destinatario y el pueblo egipcio logren exitos en sus esfuerzos por recuperar cuanto antes las consecuencias superando la tristeza.

articles.title: Otorgados en RPDC grados academicos y categorias docentes
articles.content:
Otorgados en RPDC grados academicos y categorias docentes
						
Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fueron otorgados los titulos academicos y grados docentes a los intelectuales con motivo del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					Quedaron concedidos el titulo de academico a Pak Tong Ho, investigador del Instituto Veterinario de la Academia de Ciencias Agricolas, y el titulo de candidato al academico a Jon Chol Rye, investigador del Instituto Superior de Hidraulica de Hamhung.
					
					13 personas incluyendo Kim Song Ho, jefe de catedra de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Ri Kwang Su, jefe de catedra de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, y Kim Song Yu, jefe de seccion del Hospital Universal de la Cruz Roja de Corea, recibieron el grado docente de profesor titular.
					
					El titulo de doctor fue otorgado a Kim Kum Suk, jefa de catedra de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, a Kil Jong Su, jefe de catedra del Instituto Superior de Pesqueria de Nampho, y a Pak Song Ryong, director de la Fabrica de Aparatos de Iluminacion Samcholli, y el grado de candidato al profesor titular a 138 personas.
					
					La ceremonia de otorgamiento tuvo lugar hoy en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae.
